subsection.name: Description
subsection.p: A check for detecting single lines that match a supplied regular expression. Works with any file type.
Rationale: This check can be used to prototype checks and to find common bad practice such as calling ex.printStacktrace(), System.out.println(), System.exit(), etc.

tr.td: message which is used to notify about violations, if empty then default(hard-coded) message is used.
Controls whether to ignore case when searching.
The minimum number of matches required in each file.
The maximum number of matches required in each file.
file type extension of files to process

subsection.name: Examples
subsection.p: To configure the check to find trailing whitespace at the end of a line:
subsection.source: <module name="RegexpSingleline"> <!-- \s matches whitespace character, $ matches end of line. --> <property name="format" value="\s+$"/> </module>
subsection.p: To configure the check to find trailing whitespace at the end of a line, with some slack of allowing two occurances per file:
subsection.source: <module name="RegexpSingleline"> <property name="format" value="\s+$"/> <!-- next line not required as 0 is the default --> <property name="minimum" value="0"/> <property name="maximum" value="2"/> </module>
subsection.p: An example of how to configure the check to make sure a copyright statement is included in the file:
subsection.source: <module name="RegexpSingleline"> <property name="format" value="This file is copyrighted"/> <property name="minimum" value="1"/> <!-- Need to specify a maximum, so 10 times is more than enough. --> <property name="maximum" value="10"/> </module>

subsection.name: Description
subsection.p: This class is variation on RegexpSingleline for detecting single lines that match a supplied regular expression in Java files. It supports suppressing matches in Java comments.

tr.td: message which is used to notify about violations, if empty then default(hard-coded) message is used.
Controls whether to ignore case when searching.
The minimum number of matches required in each file.
The maximum number of matches required in each file.
Controls whether to ignore text in comments when searching.

subsection.name: Examples
subsection.p: To configure the check for calls to System.out.println, except in comments:
subsection.source: <module name="RegexpSinglelineJava"> <!-- . matches any character, so we need to escape it and use \. to match dots. --> <property name="format" value="System\.out\.println"/> <property name="ignoreComments" value="true"/> </module>
